The Qysaghanni Fortress was the headquarters of the syl-pasha of Calimshans Imperial Guard, el Qysaghanni.
The fortress was located in Palace Ward of Calimport, but it did not belong to any of that wards sabban. It was immediately adjacent to the Pashas Sabban to the north. Its walls bordered Darehj Sabban to the west and Najlet Sabban to the east. To the south was Tavihr Sabban in neighboring Armada Ward.
The fortress was a cluster of three- and four-story buildings and included a five-story, free-standing  minaret.
The minaret was called the Lambent Minaret and stood in the center of the fortress complex. It appeared to be made entirely of transparent blue crystal one could see through the tower to see the fortress walls on the other side. However, it was impossible to see anything on the actual inside of the tower, even through thew open archways at the minarets balconies.
The defensive walls of the fortress connected to the neighboring wall of the Pashas Sabban, and they stood taller than the parallel walls of the other three bordering sabbans.
The fortress contained an armory and a library.) There was a courtyard for combat drills and spell practice.
Secret passages from the fortress led through sabban walls into the Pashas Sabban, to each of its buildings.
The fortress served as a garrison for the 500 troops of el Qysaghanni.
The Qysaghanni owned a set of five flying carpets, with which they frequently set out patrols over the areas surrounding the Pashas Sabban, launching from the Lambent Minaret.
